references.paper_title: Learn then Test: Calibrating Predictive Algorithms to Achieve Risk Control
references.reason: This paper introduces the Learn then Test framework, which is a foundational method for risk control and is directly compared against in the current work.
This paper introduces Conformal Risk Control, a key method for providing risk guarantees, and its adaptation to the early-exit setting is a major contribution of the current work.
This paper provides the Upper Confidence Bound method used for high-probability risk control, a crucial element in the proposed safe early-exiting approach.
This paper is the most closely related prior work, applying risk control to early-exit language models, which the current work improves upon and extends.

references.paper_title: Branchynet: Fast inference via early exiting from deep neural networks
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of early-exit neural networks (EENNs), which is the primary focus of the current work.
